senses.sense_definition: Relating to or situated near the epiglottis, the flap of cartilage at the root of the tongue.

examples.text: The doctor examined the patient's <w>epiglottal</w> region to check for any signs of swelling or infection.
Damage to the <w>epiglottal</w> tissue can significantly impair a person's ability to swallow safely.

senses.sense_definition: Describing a speech sound articulated with the epiglottis against the pharyngeal wall.

examples.text: In some languages, an <w>epiglottal</w> stop functions as a distinct phoneme that changes the meaning of words.
The student practiced the <w>epiglottal</w> fricative repeatedly to master the difficult pronunciation.

senses.sense_definition: A consonant sound produced by obstructing airflow using the epiglottis.

examples.text: The linguist recorded native speakers to analyze the acoustic properties of their <w>epiglottals</w>.
Distinguishing between pharyngeals and <w>epiglottals</w> can be challenging for those learning the language.
